conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be traced through baffles to predict whether it flows into container D or E.
Inlet A is located at the top left, inlet B is at the top center, and inlet C is at the top right. Containers D and E are located at the bottom left and bottom right respectively.
Brown, yellow, red, and grey baffles are positioned diagonally within the image, directing the flow of liquid.
Liquid from inlet A flows downward and hits the angled brown baffle.
The brown baffle directs the liquid towards the red baffle.
The red baffle redirects the liquid towards the bottom left, into container D.
Liquid from inlet B flows downward and hits the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the liquid towards the grey baffle.
The grey baffle redirects the liquid to the right, leading into container E.
Liquid from inlet C flows downward and hits the grey baffle.
The grey baffle redirects the liquid towards the bottom right, into container E.
Liquid from inlet A flows into container D.
Liquid from inlets B and C flow into container E.
Final answer: Container D receives liquid from A, and container E receives liquid from B and C.
